metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2122 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
DOS / potential heap overwrite in qtdemux using zlib decompression. Integer overflow in qtdemux element in qtdemux_inflate function which causes a segfault, or could cause a heap overwrite, depending on libc and OS. Depending on the libc used, and the underlying OS capabilities, it could be just a segfault or a heap overwrite.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer1.0-gtk3 - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-qt5 - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1.1
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> openjfx includes qtdemux.c from gstreamer and might be affected. leosilva> same as CVE-2022-1922,23,24 and 25.

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good1.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.3-0ubuntu1.1').
openjfx package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
